page.title: 06LOCAL ECOLOGY _ BORTH
page.content: We are situated within easy reach of a variety of contrasting ecological habitats. Within the area itself is the rocky shore, cliff face, sea, upper grassland areas and bog, Cors Fochno. Within easy reach are the Ynyslas sand dunes, Dyfi estuary and salt marsh. {Cors Fochno} is the largest and most important sea level bog of its kind in Europe.About 12,000 years ago, it was a lake with a reed bed which grew into a forest. A change in sea level swamped the forest and the bog was formed. The bog has a collection of rare plants and animals, including a rare species of marsh orchid, visits from the Greenland white fronted geese, the rosy marsh moth which was rediscovered there in 1965 and a rare harvest mouse discovered a few years ago.
